institution: Human Resources Development Service of Korea
category: Skill Competition Management Rules/Article 29 (Participant Qualifications and Participation Procedures)
contents: Article 29 (Participating Player Qualifications and Participation Procedures) ① Pursuant to Article 27 of the Enforcement Decree, the qualifications for participation in domestic competitions are as follows: 1. Deleted 2021. 1. 8., 2. Those who can participate in national competitions are eligible to participate in the local competition in the relevant year. A winner of a competition or a skills competition recognized by the Minister of Employment and Labor held in the year immediately preceding the national competition (referring to a private skills competition entrusted and supported by the corporation) shall be a person recommended by a city/provincial committee. However, non-Korean citizens cannot participate in the national competition. Revised on August 4, 2017. Those who fall under Table 5-1 cannot participate in domestic competitions. New 2019. 4. 9., ② Those wishing to participate in local competitions must submit a participation application in accordance with Article 15 of the Enforcement Rules to the relevant city/provincial committee., ③ Those wishing to participate in national competitions must submit an application form in accordance with Article 15 of the Enforcement Rules. You must fill out a participation application and receive a recommendation from the city/provincial committee of the region where you won the prize in the local competition (Form No. 15) to participate as a member of the relevant city/provincial committee. The city/provincial committee creates a joint list of participating players and recommends them in bulk. This can be done., ④ Matters regarding the recommendation of winners of skill competitions recognized by the Minister of Employment and Labor to national competitions shall be in accordance with the Corporation's “Private Skills Competition Support Management Guidelines.”
